characters: I/E. DALE AN SAUL'S STOLEN COP CAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN BLACK AND WHITE, A black 1930s Cadillac speeds down the only visible road amidst endless plains of farmland. The road curves sharply ahead - the car accelerates. Ignoring the turn, the Caddy drives directly off the road and through a massive field of emptiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car abruptly stops in the middle of the vacant field. GENERAL BRAT (58, a patch covers one of his eyes) and AGENT BLACK SUIT (an agent in a black suit) step out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although there is clearly nothing in sight for miles, the General scans his surroundings with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Black Suit crouches down and pulls open a METAL HATCH in the ground. Both men walk down the hatch and into the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They descend a metal staircase and walk with great urgency down a narrow corridor. The hallway spills into a hauntingly huge metal room with a lone SCIENTIST standing in the middle. The Scientist immediately begins leading them across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did it start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At 05:00. We're seven minutes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three men enter a large room divided by a one-way mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On their side, numerous SCIENTISTS, utilizing several archaic devices, are busy at work monitoring the subject on the other side of the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The subject: PRIVATE MILLER (22, naive and dutiful) sits at a small table with a microphone on it. Miller raises his hand, REVEALING a smoldering JOINT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a long and awkward hit from the joint and bursts into a coughing fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scientists begin to scribble profusely as their devices blink manically. General Brat and Agent Black Suit exchange a concerned look. The General lights a cigarette as the Scientist steps up to a small microphone in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into microphone) Private Miller, we are now going to ask you several questions. How do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice booms through large speakers on Miller's side of the room. Miller leans towards the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I feel a little queer sir. But... It's good. Good queer. (beat) Sir. Good queer, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scientists scribble madly. One of them mumbles into General Brat's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...uh...even though I feel queer, Sir, I should mention that I'm also feeling quite gay...so, a little queer, but mostly gay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Private Miller. When you think of your superiors, what emotions do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding out the joint) This went out...Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will send someone in. Now answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens beside Private Miller and an AGENT steps out wearing an intricate uniform that resembles an old fashioned diving suit, an air hose leading out the door that he came from. He slowly walks toward the Private, who looks at him in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through speakers) Private Miller? Answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...um...what was the question again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Agent in the strange suit reaches the private and holds a lighter up to the joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through speakers) What are your emotions towards your superiors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller pulls at the joint until it is lit again. The Agent exits the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COUGH   COUGH  Fucking shit. (beat) Well, now that I think of it, it's strange that they are called my `superiors'. Does that make me their `inferior'? I mean, that's pretty fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Brat scowls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (curtly to the scientists) I've seen enough. Shut it down. Bury the hatch, sell the land, and dispose of him. This never happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instantly, the scientists start packing up their equipment. Staring at Miller, General Brat grabs a RED PHONE and dials. Two Agents in the scuba-like suits emerge from behind Miller and start aggressively dragging him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaking out) Hey! What the...what are you guys doing!               Let go of me! (desperately looking at the mirror) Sir!!! Sir!!! Help me!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) This is General Brat. We've reached a final conclusion on Item 9. (beat) Illegal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE DENTON (late 20s, out of shape, slightly unkempt) looks out of place in his black suit as he drives he sits in his cluttered and worn old lady car. He smokes a joint while listening to talk radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's look at the facts.                         Financially, coins are better because                  they're cheaper, and environmentally,                  forget-about-it, coins win hands down.                 For those just joining us, we're with                  caller Dale Denton discussing if America               should lose the paper dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see that Dale has a wireless ear piece in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not! Who wants a pocket full of              coins? Seriously. Weighs down your pants,              clangs around. With all this unnecessary               new security everywhere, we'll be setting              off alarms left and right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We certainly do, Mr. Denton. Crude, but                to the point. Next caller!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale puts away his phone and pulls up in front of a nice house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale, wearing a name tag that reads "Garth", holding a clip board and wearing a greenpeace hat, knocks repeatedly on the door. A woman cautiously answers the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, I didn't order a pizza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, miss? Are you Sandra Danby

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...yea-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale shoves an envelope into her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, miss, but you've failed to show up              to your divorce proceedings 4 times under              court order. You've been served.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh great! Thanks a lot asshole! Real                   clever! Go fuck yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale dashes back to his car as the upset woman starts to open the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale is driving and smoking a joint. He looks at his check list - it is a list of people he served that day. He's only got a few left. He listens to a different talk radio dj while playing music from a tiny iPod boom box that sits in his passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...forget about Area 51, Roswell                       sightings, Atlantis and the Boogie Man,                let's talk about real threats, threats to              our home and security...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' eh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His iPod starts playing HOT STEPPA by INI KAMOZE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice! Hot Steppa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale turns down the talk radio and puffs away at his joint; he enthusiastically dances in his car while singing along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) You think you know, chico/I know what Bo, don't know/touch them up and go - uh oh!/ Chi-chi-ching-chang!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale, wearing a Zerox hat, walks into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just here to check out some units.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The secretary nods and goes back to her work. Dale casually waltzes down the office halls looking at the names on the doors. He glances down at his clipboard, it read: Walter Tandum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds the office and knocks on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale enters to see Walter, a 40 year old accountant, seated at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Hey there. Are you here to fix the                 fax machines?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale drops a blue envelope on Walter's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You owe American Express $4068 dollars.                Sorry, but you've been served.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale turns and walks away. As he does, he notices a small kitchen. He enters and is delighted at the array of snacks and beverages. He helps himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale is parked at a look-out enjoying the food, smoking weed and has his ear piece in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What gives you the right to say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything! They should be able to                     collect garbage TWICE a week. Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a tax payer, can't I say that? Come                 get my garbage a bit more! Is that so f-               ing crazy? I'm not asking for free beer                Tuesday's or anything. And the whole city              would be more aesthetically pleasing and               smell better. And don't pretend you can't              smell it. Ever been to New York? Great                 place, smells like piss, though.                       (takes a hit and starts                         coughing)                                      Twice a week,  cough  might fix that.                  (starts coughing harder)                        Hold on one sec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale gets out of his car, followed by some plumes of smoke, and goes to his trunk. He chuckles as he takes out a lab coat and walks towards the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale, looking very professional in his lab coat, rushes to reception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need Dr. Terrence, immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. One moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The receptionist immediately picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. TERRENCE runs towards reception, where Dale is still waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dale)                                       Hi there, I don't think we've met, I'm-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Edgar Terrence. You're the guy who                 repeatedly refused to take care of the                 monkey tree that spills onto your                      neighbors property. And now, because of                that, you've been served.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale hits a pipe. It is clear he strongly disagrees with what the DJ is saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...stay in your own country. Five simple               words. And stay the hell out of mine! I'm              not a racist, per se, but I'm not some                 hippy tree humper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see his ear piece and hear that he is on hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me through, damnit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale, wearing a chauffeur hat, stands by the main entrance holding a sign that reads: JOSH CORBER. A man walks out of the hotel and, seeing the sign, approaches Dale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Corber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Joshua Aaron Corber?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overjoyed) Get out of town! Clarice did this, didn't she? I was just telling her before I left how I've never been in a limo. Can you believe it? 35 and I've never been in a limo. Man! It's not stretched, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale hands him a BLUE ENVELOPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, but you've been served.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale walks away. CORBER opens the envelope and reads it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah fuck! (reads more) Fuck! You fucking asshole!!! FUCK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale completely ignores Corber as he dumps the sign and walks out of the airport. Then, a huge smile comes across his face. He has noticed a nearby Burger King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Hey! Nice. New chicken fries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He happily walks toward the food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale sits in his car   outside a high school. An array of Burger King wrappers   surrounds him as he rolls a joint with the last of his   weed on top of a Batman comic. He lights the joint and   turns on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...3:09 in the PM and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale turns off the radio, takes one last haul, and then snubs out the joint. He then pulls out a small leather kit and sifts through it's contents: handi-wipes, hand sanitizer, a little vial of cologne, Visine, mouthwash and breath mints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale vigorously wipes his hands, face, and mouth with wet naps and then starts futilely attempting to put visine in his blazing red eyes. Frustrated, he squirts Visine all over his finger tips and simply rubs them into his eyes. He uses the mouthwash, chews up a mint, dabs on some cologne, and then gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale walks towards the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale turns to see his attractive 19 year old girlfriend, ANGIE ANDERSON, walking towards him with her group of friends. She kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm. Minty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo Dale. `sup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Kyle.                                           (to Angie)                                   So, should we head back to my place and             finish up the trilogy? Matrix:                      Revolution. Whose it gonna be, Angie? Man           or machine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. But can we just head to my               locker first? I left some stuff by                  mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale and Angie walk hand in hand towards the locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, are you going to come over for dinner           tomorrow, `cause my parents are beginning           to think I made you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah, I really want to meet them.             Tomorrow, tomorrow, tomorrow...let me               think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to feel weird about it.              They know how old you are and they're               fine with it. They just want to meet you            and see that you're a cool guy and that             I'm not dating you just because you're              older.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I know that. It's                        just...tomorrow's tight. I've got a whole           bunch of cases that I can finish                    tomorrow. It's probably going to take me            into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. Well, then you have to just come              over sometime this week or something,               okay? `Cause it's getting weird for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. I promise. I'm not trying to                   avoid this, for real, I've just been                   crazy busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale and Angie turn to see a TEACHER, a guy about the same age as Dale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't just waltz in here and hit on                the students. Get out now before I-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Edwards, he's my boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Edwards looks at Dale, then shoots Angie a confused look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your boyfriend? How old are you,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're dating an 18 year old?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm 19. I moved here from Morocco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale doesn't know what to make of Mr. Edwards comments and looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, well this school is for students              and faculty only. Friends can't just stop              by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, you may be a teacher here, but                   we're about the same age, so don't get                 all high and mighty. It's not that weird.              Frankly, it's natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, in that case, get off school                     property or I'm calling the Police                     Liaison officer. Angie, no offense to                  you, but if this guy's dating someone                  your age, it's because nobody his age                  will date him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, four HANDSOME AND FIT STUDENTS walk by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Angie. You were hilarious in drama                 today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie smiles at the guys. Dale doesn't like how all this is going down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wait in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale and Angie sit in the parked car making out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, do you want to get some food?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...actually I can't. I have to go serve              a guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It sucks. I'm sorry. We can hang                 out later though. You can come over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see if Neo is truly the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a long kiss, and Angie gets out of the car. Dale watches her walk away, then whips out his cell phone and hits speed dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone) Yo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo. It's Dale. Mind if I come by and pick up some shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAUL SILVER is constructing a CROSS-SHAPED JOINT (two joints that intersect one another). Pot and paraphernalia are scattered all over the coffee table. A large "Scarface" movie poster hangs on the wall. There is a knock at the door and Dale enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, Saul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unpleasantly surprised) What the fuck?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't buzz you in. How the monkey did you get in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa...sorry, man. someone just let me in. I-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fucked up, man! This building is filled with fuckin' assholes. What else is the buzzer for? Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll buzz next time, man. I'm real sorry.           I'm just not familiar with your,                    uh...protocol yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, stuff your sorry's i n a sack, bro.            We're always cool. It's those fuckin' jaggoffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale awkwardly sits down on the other side of the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brass tacs. I've got this new bud. Unfortunately, it's a few more bones, but fortunately, it's hands down the dopest fuckin' shit I ever smoked. And I've smoked some dope fuckin' shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than that Blue Oyster weed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude. Seriously. It's like if that Blue Oyster shit and the Afghan Kush I got had a baby, and meanwhile, the craziest Northern Lights and that red-ass Espresso Snowflake had a baby, and then by some miracle those babies met, and fucked - then this would be the shit they'd birth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul pulls out a big bag of weed. He places it on the coffee table as though it was his child. He pulls out a large bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smell it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale takes the weed and looks at it. It looks spectacular. Bright red hairs and large crystals, huge purple and blue leaves - just spectacular! Dale smells it and is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? It's spectacular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called Pineapple Express. My guy Red told me it's when this Hawaiian flood takes special dirt to the weed or some shit. It's pretty scientific. And I'm the only guy in the whole city who has it. And, its only ten bones more for a quarter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...can I get a quarter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No doubt. Just let me grab my scale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul walks into another room. Dale looks around anxiously; he clearly wants to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment later, Saul comes back into the room and sits down. Dale notices that he didn't bring anything back from the other room. Saul notices Dale looking at him strangely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the look? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the scale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit! The scale. Be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul hustles into the other room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from other room) You know what's weird? How sometimes, your brain just chooses to like, not keep things in it, you know? (beat) Fucking scale. (beat) Shit. Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale checks his watch and then looks at the door; suddenly, something catches his eye - it's the cross- joint Saul was constructing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit! What the fuck is this thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul comes back in and puts a small electronic scale on the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nonchalantly) Ah, the cross-joint. You've never seen one of these? Not surprising. They are, like, the apex of the vortex of joint engineering. NASA built the first one in               the eighties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul chuckles at his joke as he places some weed on the scale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can actually smoke that contraption?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul puts Dale's weed in a baggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You light all three ends at the same time, then, you smoke it as it resonates the main section, creating a "trifecta" of smoking power. It's like, three times as powerful as a normal joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale hands Saul some money and Saul gives him his weed. Dale lingers for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, be careful with that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale gets up and heads to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude...you wanna smoke this thing with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale turns around. He clearly wants to smoke it, but he tries to play it cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't even light it on my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale sits back down on the couch, giddy as a schoolgirl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Wow. So like, uh...so like, so like what do I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul gathers three lighters from the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Firstly you light these two ends. Then I will light the tip, making the trifecta complete. Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale nods and they light the joint. Saul tokes hard; plumes of smoke fill the air as he bursts into a COUGHING FIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale takes the joint and hits it, exploding into a coughing fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's...uh, it's good to cough.  COUGH  It opens the  COUGH  capillaries...gets you twenty-five percent higher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that, combined with the pineapple weed, and the cross-joint  COUGH  you're a good thirty to forty times higher. I don't know the exact math, but, pff, you're pretty fucking gong-showed. You know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul takes a toke. Dale coughs HARDER and HARDER. He seems like he might throw up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's crazy. The better the weed, the more I wish I could think of how to explain what's so good about it, but the...uh, the better it is, the less shit I can think of in total, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul passes Dale the joint, obliviously dropping ash all over his suit. Slightly agitated, Dale brushes it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so, like, you've been buying from me for, like, a few months now and I really gotta ask. (beat) What's with the suit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a process server.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You`re a servant? Like, a butler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, process server.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hired to give people papers they                  don't want. It's pretty much the easiest job on earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice, man. Where'd you get that job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale takes a big hit from the joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...uh, I got a totally useless degree two years ago, then I did nothing for a year, then my dad got so fed up he hooked me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both revel in the thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it pretty sweet, though. Today? I             smoked like five joints, gave out some              pieces of paper, and I ate some Burger              King-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man, did you get those new chicken fries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale passes the join to Saul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah man. I'd get on that shit. They're fucking mind blowing. So, then I hot-               boxed my car and then...got some action             from my girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul laughs at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does she smoke pot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little. She's in high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fuckin' sweet! Ilegal love! You're           like Jerry Lee Lewis. I just read his               biography.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. She's 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dissappointed)                              Oh. It's still cool I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's awesome, although I think                she's getting old enough where she's                realizing I don't do much. And these high           school guys these days. They're all                 roided out and going to Harvard. Even on            my best days, I look like a fat, dumb               piece of shit next to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever, man. It sounds like you got it            pretty good. I wish I had a job that                easy. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude...you've got, like, the actual                  easiest job in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! You're right, man. I never thought              of it like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can actually do whatever the hell you            want. You get to sleep all day and people            come buy weed at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale passes Saul the joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's totally true. Except tomorrow.                Thanks to that bitch daylight savings, I             gotta go change my grandma's clocks forward at 7am. Or 8am. I seriously can't figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to hear that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul passes Dale the joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, so, like, what have these people done that you go after?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see...tonight I'm going after-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale pulls a blue envelope out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted Jones. He forgot to pay his-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude! My guy, Red, gets his weed from a Ted Jones. He's, like, #1 supplier in town. Maybe it's him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt that, man. There's probably a lot of Ted Joneses's out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but not like this one, man! He's what I want to be one day. He's like the "Jesus of Weed". So...I guess he's like Jah. Or Scarface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul points to his Scarface poster. The joint ends. After a few moments it seems as though their ability to have a conversation burnt out with the joint. They sit in awkward silence. Dale gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Saul, that was crazy. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No worries dude, peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They slap each other five and Dale exits. Saul turns on the TV. Saved By the Bell is on. It makes Saul chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale cruises down side streets and locates Ted's house. It is a large well-to-do home. Having difficulties, Dale parks in between two cars across the street. He turns off the engine and starts smoking a joint. SUDDENLY - FLASH! Two head lights appear up the street. Holy shit! It's a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits still, holding the joint between his legs as the cop car drives past and...parks a few cars down! The FEMALE COP walks up the block - TOWARDS DALE'S CAR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fortunately,   the COP crosses the street and walks towar Ted's house.   Confused, Dale watches as she is let in. Dale waits a   moment and then re-lights the joint. He tries to see   into Ted's house as he takes a MASSIVE TOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG! A SILENCE SHATTERING BLAST comes from Ted's house. Dale holds the toke in and tries to keep quiet as he focuses on the large front window. SUDDENLY, the drapes are torn down by an ASIAN MAN as he falls forwards and crashes through the front window!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale watches in horror as a LARGE GREY-HAIRED MAN and the Female Cop step forward and shoot the Asian man! BLAM! BLAM! Blood splatters!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale starts COUGHING UNCONTROLLABLY! He starts the car and, in a panicked fit, tries to pull out. CRASH!!! He smashes directly into the car in front of him! He flicks the roach out onto the grass and slams the car in reverse - CRUNCH!!! He backs into the car behind him! Still hacking his lungs out, Dale drives away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Grey-Haired Man and the Female Cop sprint out of the house in time to see Dale's distant tail lights vanish into the darkness. Something catches the Grey-Haired Man's eye - a trail of smoke rising from the grass. He lowers his blood-stained hand and picks up...DALE'S ROACH! He brings it to his nose and sniffs, then rips open the paper and examines the weed closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pineapple Express.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul is laying on his couch watching Saved By the Bell, laughing so hard that he's crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! Ha! Ha! Screech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the BUZZER sounds repeatedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbles) Fucking hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grudgingly walks to the intercom and presses talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through intercom) ...me in! Let me in! Let me in!    Let me in! It's Dale! Let m--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul casually presses the talk button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyingly casual) Denton? Dale Denton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles to himself, then presses listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through intercom) ...the love of shit, let me in! Pleeea-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annoyed, Saul buzzes him in and unlocks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) ...fucking, don't smoke that shit if you can't handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment later, Dale, completely freaking out, BURSTS through the door and SLAMS it shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) Dude, whoa. What the fuck are-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fucking killed him, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be quiet, man, I got neighbors-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) He killed him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud) Somebody killed somebody?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, man! I can't believe it. A cop! A lady, and a guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody killed a cop, a lady and a guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! A guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cop killed a guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! A cop and a guy killed   another guy! The lady and the guy...No,   a fucking woman, a police woman, and   an old guy, shot a guy, a younger guy,   in the fucking window at Ted's house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was the guy Ted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, the old guy who shot the guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't fucking know. He was this big, old, grey haired guy with a gun, and he fucking took him, and he shot him! Right there in the fucking window! BAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard Ted's got grey hair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they saw me! They saw me see them shoot the guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul jumps to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!?! They saw you?!? Why the fuck did you come here? Did they follow you?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul dashes to the window and peeks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they follow you here!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I panicked. I was having a coughing fit, I crashed, I crashed into a car. Fuck, two cars. They must've heard at least. They knew someone was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they don't know it's you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't think so. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...they're not coming here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale shakes his head, on the verge of tears. Saul shrugs, sits back down, then picks up his joint and re-lites it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. So, what's your game-plan? You gonna call the cops? Cause if you do, I'd appreciate it if you left my shit out of this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not calling the cops - one of them was a cop. They could all be cops!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see any blood? Was it sick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I saw some blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder who the guy he shot was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, who do drug dealers kill? It was probably another drug dealer. He was Asian. Are there Asian drug dealers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah, man. The Koreans teamed up with, like, the Vietnamese or some shit. They're crazy mother fuckers. Number two in town. (beat) Heh. Ted's cappin' the competition. Yo, you want some of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul passes Dale the joint. Dale takes the joint and frantically smokes as he paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, like, exactly what was the sequence of happenings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sitting across from Ted's smoking a massive joint of that weed you sold me-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the Pineapple Express. It's so rare it's almost a shame to smoke it, like killing a unicorn...with, like, a bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I threw it...out...the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale stops pacing and stares at Saul. He then looks down at the joint of pineapple weed. Saul notices wheels turning in Dale's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale continues staring at the joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This weed is actually that rare?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proudly) Yeah, it's like, "the rarest".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you are actually the only guy in town with this weed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' rights, I am. Red told me he was giving me an "exclusive sneak preview".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And am I the only guy you gave it to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. So, we're the only guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, like, another dealer, couldn't identify it, the pineapple weed? Like, if they found a roach of it, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicking) We should go, we shouldn't be here! We should go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...seriously, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left a roach of this weed in front of Ted's house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what? I leave roaches all over fucking town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, listen - they could find the roach and say, "This is pineapple weed, Saul's the only guy in town who has pineapple weed, therefore he must have witnessed the murder or know who did - let's go kill him."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Saul understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother of fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SPRINGS to his feet and BOLTS for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale grabs Saul and stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why!?! Let go of me! Let's get the fuck out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul, wait! Grab anything we might need, like your weed and money and stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul grabs his bag of weed and shoves it in his backpack. They run for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you're not forgetting anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul and Dale run to the elevator and frantically press the button, terrified for their lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! I forgot something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul runs back to his apartment, leaving Dale alone and frightened. Saul BURSTS back out of his apartment holding his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, I was so scared going back, I thought there was gonna be guys there, and then you'd be gone, and there was this music in my head-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take the stairs, it'll be faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They scramble towards the distant stairwell. Almost at the door, they hear the DING of the elevator arriving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back! Go back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They DASH back to the elevator. Dale shoves his arm between the doors and they hop in. Saul rapidly presses the LOBBY button as the doors shut. They're both on the verge of hyperventilating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, man. We gotta try to relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't want to draw attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaking out) Whose attention!?! You think they could be down there? In the Lobby? Right now!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! Who knows? Just try to be cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DING  The elevator SUDDENLY STOPS on the second floor.

dialogues.speaker: DALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my god!!!                  Ahhh!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors OPEN! There's no one there. The doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was bad - Calm! Calm! Calm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator stops at the lobby and the doors open, they step out, bumping into two rough looking guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Pardon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale and Saul quickly leave as the bikers enter the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rough looking guys, BUDLOFSKY and MATHESON, kick in Saul's door and dash into the room, guns drawn. Matheson spots a smoldering joint in the ashtray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Budlofsky whips out his cell and hits speed dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted? He's gone, but he was just here. I               think he knew we were coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale peels out of his spot and down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, what do you know about Ted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Ted? Nothing. For all I know he's tracking us with space satellites right now! He's got grey hair, that's all I knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul checks behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go to your place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way! What if they did see my license plate!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so let's got to a hotel, or a motel, or a Holiday Inn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how much money do we have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I've got is the seventy-five you gave me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how much money do you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Dale gets out his wallet, Saul opens Dale's change tray. It's full of roaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...nine bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, shut up then! I've got more than you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Forget the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tense beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish we could just go nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...where's nowhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is parked on a small dirt path in the moon-lit woods. Dale paces back and forth as Saul walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we know? Nothing. We may or may not be followed because we don't even             know if he found the roach or not. And, we could just be completely crazy. But, the question is this: even if he found the roach, how could he know where you were?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrilled) He couldn't. Cause I'm in the woods. It's impossible! Unless he's, like, hanging on the bottom of the car or some shit, but I             mean-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, what I mean is, if Ted found the roach and identified the weed, how could he connect it to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way. He could only find out from Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this Red guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red's pretty much a middleman between Ted and guys like me. And we're mad fucking tight. One time he convinced some girl he knew to give me a hand-job within, like, five minutes of me meeting her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But let's say someone calls asking who he sold this pineapple weed to, he'll say you, because...why wouldn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that. That's bullshit. He would have called me if that happened. A hand-job, Dale! Imagine if I'd gotten you a hand               job by now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but Saul, he's a fucking drug                  dealer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? I'm a fuckin' drug dealer. What, you             don't trust me then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul stares at Dale, who doesn't know how to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...I...call him. Yeah, sure, call him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleased, Saul pats Dale on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. You are. I'm just being                paranoid. Sorry, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul takes his cell phone out and presses speed dial. We hear someone pick up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through phone) Ow! Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Red. You okay man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul! Oh. I, uh...stubbed my toe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red sounds nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, watch the toes. Wear shoes in the house. But Red, I gotta get straight to brass tacs, I need a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure man, anything. I'm Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure as fuck are, buddy. So, you know how you gave me some of that pineapple express stuff? Don't tell anyone you gave it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure man, no problem. Red swears it, hombre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, can I come on over now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale waves his hands in front of Saul's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louldy whispering) No! We should do it tomorrow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering phone, talks to Dale) I'm in the middle of a convo, man. Let's just go and get this shit over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, man. Tomorrow. I'm scared shitless. I want to think things through before I do anything. Let's go in the morning. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul looks around the dark forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...okay. Less scary shit happens in the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Red?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (talking to someone else) -I can hear him talking to someone, so- Yo! Saul? So, you're gonna come by in the morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right after I see my grandma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, your Grandma's retirement home- Ow! Fuckin' stupid god-damn toe. I, uh, is that the one on Granville and 41st.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah man. I've only got one. So, we'll be chillin' by noon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul gives Dale the thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, cool brother. Noon it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should definitely hit up the casino again sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For sure. We should definitely hit up the casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul hangs up the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice. Now let's do some fucking stone cold chilling. I'll role a jigga, on the            house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RED, 30, stalky and short, sits between the BUDLOFSKY and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why isn't he coming now? What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredibly afraid) I didn't say shit, man! There was another guy there and he said tomorrow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did he mention the casino? The Asians run the casinos. Is Saul Asian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This worries the thugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This might be more than we thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Than you thought. I thought it would be                more than you did. I'll call Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always liked smoking weed in the                     forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul lights a joint and starts smoking. He passes it to Dale. Dale puffs. They look around at their expansive, dark surroundings and immediately become overwhelmed with paranoia. Saul notices a shooting star zip across the sky as Dale takes out his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to go call Angie. Make up some bull shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Dale dials, Saul, paranoid from the pot, looks at his cell phone. He takes another hit, and then looks up to the sky again. He looks back at Dale's phone. Dale starts to walk off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale...wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul snubs out the joint and runs over to Dale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the phone...I mean, I don't know how this shit works, but...can cops... you said they might be cops...could they triangulate our phones or trace `em or some shit like that? I don't know. I feel like I've seen that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale stares at Saul, then flips open his phone -  beep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, shit Dale, maybe they can trace them when we're not even on them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale takes a hit as he looks up to the sky. Just then, a loud rumbling noise is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rumbling gets louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we on fucking "Lost"?! What the hell is that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's them!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The noise builds to a deafening crescendo as the guys dive behind a tree stump. A moment later, a JUMBO JET buzzes overhead, heading towards the nearby airport. Dale and Saul pop up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy fuck. That was close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clutching cell phone) You know what? You're right. We should just get rid of them. We should just smash `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale looks at his phone, which is a new, expensive Razor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. I just bought this thing. Maybe I can just take the batteries out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Smash it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale sighs, then SMASHES his phone on a rock. Saul looks at Dale, then HURLS his phone into the woods as hard as he can, sending it SAILING into the FOREST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck was that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale tosses the joint aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! I was trying to throw it at that tree!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What tree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul points out a group of trees about 30 feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a cheap piece of shit. Came free with the plan. It must've smashed when it landed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck knows?!? I don't know!! Why couldn't you have just smashed it on a rock like a normal person?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to smash it! How often does a guy smash things? I'm rusty. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you at least see where it landed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there, somewhere. Wait! We could call it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With what? I just smashed my phone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look into the scary dark depths of the woods. Both of them are clearly terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, it's not like they got McGuyver workin' on the case. I bet they can't even triangulate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then you shouldn't have said anything, cause now you've convinced me that they can!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine! Fine. Let's just find the stupid thing and get back to doing what we were doin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrified, they cautiously inch into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, this is the scariest place I've ever been in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They nervously walk on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever see that movie where all the people are in the woods and they slowly get killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "Blair Witch Project."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...Shit. That one's way scarier than the one I was thinking of. Mine had Arnold Shwartzenegger in it. Now I'm thinking of the fucking Blair Witch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They inch forward, nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) What-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Sshh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) What is-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Sshh! Can you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Just listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) I literally hear nothing. (gasp) Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY, Saul SPRINTS off into the darkness!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale looks in horror as Saul vanishes amongst the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming in pain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale hears a loud THUD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scared for his life, he SPRINTS in the opposite direction! He weaves in between the trees, avoids some rocks and tree roots, stumbles on some loose dirt, then SLAMS half his body against a tree and FALLS HARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul gets up, covered in dirt. Panting, he looks around the forest and sees no one. He thinks he hears something and SPRINTS off! WHAM! He trips on a tree root and SLAMS into the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale stumbles to his feet while futilely trying to wipe the dirt off his suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul hears Dale and whips around, breaking a twig -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale looks towards the noise, then SPRINTS off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul hears someone and BOLTS in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like chickens with their heads cut off, they both scramble through the woods trying to evade their imaginary enemies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale spots his car! He jumps in and SLAMS the door shut. He's about to turn the ignition, but stops. Panting and wheezing, he sinks into his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! Something slams into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale sees Saul BANGING against the passenger side door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled through the window) Let me in! Let me in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale unlocks the car and Saul JUMPS in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go! Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anyone even out there?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't know then why the hell did you run like that?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! I'm freaking out, man! Let's just go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! We're not going anywhere!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there could be something out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing out there, that's why                  we're here. God, man, you scared the                   fucking shit out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not getting out of the car. I'm              staying in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of silence. They both look around. There is clearly nothing out there. Dale turns on the car. Talk radio comes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -white accent walls would go nice with a               dark colored room, say a burnt sienna,                 but don't forget...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk radio? You fuckin' joshin' me? Why                don't we just shoot ourselves in the                   nuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, okay? It's my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Well, I'm going to smoke a joint                 before I go to sleep, and don't worry                  about it, even though you're being a                   dick, it's on the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do me any fucking favors. I got my               own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale and Saul start rolling separate joints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale slowly wakes up. He stretches, and then shakes Saul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul. Saul. Get up. Wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul opens his eyes and realizes where he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy) It's too early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul brings his wrist up close to his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul stares at his watch, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't be right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul looks outside towards the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It couldn't be three in the morning, could it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's three o'clock!?! We were supposed to be there at noon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Wait! My grandma's clocks! It's daylight savings! (beat) Fuck! No! They go forwards an hour! Dammit-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's four o'fucking clock?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -I didn't go to my Grandma's! Fuck! And we've gotta call Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale digs in his pockets for the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll find a pay pho...fuck! His number was in my phone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale notices the keys are in the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember where he lives, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I remember. What the hell is that supposed to mean? Are you insinuating I'm forgetful? That's right, I know the word insinuating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns the keys. NOTHING. He tries again. NOTHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck? Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries twice more, but nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed off) I think the battery's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you fucking serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale shoots Saul an angry look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck happened? How did this happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? We fell asleep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. With your stupid talk radio. No               surprise, that stuffs, like, made to put            people to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated, Dale tries to gather his thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta...let's just...we'll walk. We'll           walk to a road and hitchhike to Red's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale opens his door and hops out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, "for real". We'll be late, but                we'll get there. Then we can fix this insane situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Dale and Saul walk down a seemingly unused forest road, each smoking their own joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Saul points out a giant caterpillar crawling on a leaf. Dale is grossed out. Saul pokes the caterpillar and then blows weed smoke onto it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop fucking around, man. Come on. Leave            that thing alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - They emerge at the highway and try to hitch a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Dale notices Saul has his thumb sticking out of his zipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like, my thumb is my cock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale doesn't laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Bored and tired, they wait.   Saul lights a joint. Dale notices. Saul shifts his body   away from Dale. Just then an eighteen wheeler slows for   them. Saul snubs out the freshly lit joint and puts it   in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale and Saul get out of the eighteen wheeler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the driver) Thanks a fucking ton, Sharid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul shuts the door and he and Dale run towards Red's house - a small, dilapidated place in a rundown part of town. Exhausted, Dale and Saul reach Red's door. Saul knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what's this guy like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. He's short...and stout. So he's like a tea pot. Hehe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, do you think he'll be there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I mean, we are only...eight hours late. (beat)                                          That's actually pretty late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through door) Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red! It's Saul. Open up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red opens the door. He has a SPLIT LIP and has clearly been CRYING. He tries to act normal. Dale immediately suspects something is up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sniffling) Who's this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale. Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red ushers them in and shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's    better if you don't know my            last-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (oblivious) Dale Denton. He's with me. No worries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red notices their dirty clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Saul) What happened to your clothes? Where'd you call me from, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale notices Red quivering as he lights a cigarette and becomes increasingly suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were in the forest laying low. Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Red...what...uh, is your lip okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul finally notices Red's dishevelled appearance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Dude, have you been crying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Oh, I uh... (feeling his split lip) ...I got a cold sore, I've never got one before. I started crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cold sore? Is that fucking herpes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...uh, yeah, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ewwww! That's sick, man. Do you know how many joints we've shared? I told you, man. This is from that time you ate the                lollypop straight from the strippers sna-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul. Ask him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAUL (to Dale)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Captain Demando. Can you just chill out, maybe? So, Red. I gotta ask-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, first of all, stop. What's this all about? That's what I want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Well, Dale's a servant for protest lawyers, and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa! Saul, I don't think...well, Red, I don't mean to be rude but I don't think we should tell you any more than you need to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that, Dale. This is my house, I deserve to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude! Let's just tell him. It is his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. Red, I just don't want to pull you into the shit we're in. It's just trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be weird about this. If he wants trouble, it's his right to have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Whoa! I don't want trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why we only need to clarify one thing - nobody's called about Saul or the pineapple express or anything like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one. Nada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awesome! Look at that! Everything's fine. We had a crazy night in the woods, which              I assume we can both put behind us like               grown ups, and now we can use Red's giant             bong to get super-duper high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale doesn't seem convinced. Saul picks up Red's huge bong and starts to pack a bit of Red's weed into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, well, wicked. Make yourselves at home. I'm just going to use the ol' telephone-o.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul sits down and picks up a lighter as Red walks towards the phone. Dale watches Red, suspicious of his odd behavior. Red begins to dial...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMACK! Dale knocks the phone out of Red's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul jumps up. Dale SNATCHES the phone and backs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry! I'm sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale!   What the fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Saul) We can't let him call anyone! He's acting weird!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you man - this is my house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I just, I don't think I can-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale! You fucking nut. You're stoned and paranoid. Just chill the shit out, guy! (to Red)                                       I'm sorry, Red. I shouldn't have brought              this guy over here, he's a total lunatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without warning, Red grabs a LARGE ASHTRAY filled with cigarette butts and WHIPS it at Dale. BAM! It smashes him in the head!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in pain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash EXPLODES everywhere as Dale drops the phone and clutches his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy cock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red approaches the cowering Dale. Saul intercedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude! He's sorry! Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red PUNCHES Saul in the face! Saul SCREAMS and drops to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale snatches the phone and scurries into the bathroom, slamming the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disoriented, Dale scans the small bathroom. Saul and Red can be heard fighting outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, we're friends, what the fuck is                  wrong with you? Ow! Dude! Are you fucked               off that shit again!?! Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to! They'll kill me!!! Please                   don't fight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud CRASH is heard from the other room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale throws the phone in the toilet bowl and smacks down the seat. He runs back to help Saul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red is BEATING the shit out of Saul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, man!?! Why!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul manages to stand up when Red boots him in the BALLS! He SHRIEKS and stumbles backwards. Dale dashes into the room and LEAPS onto Red's back. Red wobbles forward, then starts RUNNING BACKWARDS. He trips on his coffee table and CRASHES Dale through it, landing on top of him. Red gets up, sprints into the bathroom and locks the door. With great effort, Dale and Saul manage to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going for the phone! Bathroom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frantically searching for the phone, Red flips the toilet seat up and grabs it. He begins to dial as Dale and Saul sprint down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Red is about to finish dialing, Dale and Saul CRASH into the bathroom door! They knock it completely off it's hinges, SLAMMING it directly into Red! The phone flies into the bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at the phone) SAUL!!! Phone!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul jumps into the bathtub and begins STOMPING the phone. Dale continuously SLAMS his body against the door in an attempt to keep Red pinned down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck Red!?! What the fuck is going on!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!!! They're going to kill me!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't stub your toe, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red stops struggling and tries to catch his breath. Dale kneels on top of the door, keeping him pinned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now tell us-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna come back and kill me!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an impressive show of strength, Red shoves the door off him, knocking Dale aside. He runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul chases Red and TACKLES him into a wall. Dale follows seconds later, and notices Red's LARGE GLASS BONG. He looks back to see Saul getting pummelled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale grabs the bong and swings around - CRASH!!! It shatters on the back of Red's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red falls to the ground moaning, blood dripping from his head. Dale and Saul stand over him, out of breath, bruised and battered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red, you motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale, lost in thought, starts to seriously freak out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's happening! It's actually happening! He knows my name! Red knows my name!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should beat it out of his sellout brains. You're a shitty friend, Red! Fuck the Casino! Go alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is fucked, what do we do now, he knows my name!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows my name too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what do we do? He's gonna tell them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not gonna have to kill him, are we? I don't think I could do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale stares at the almost motionless Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we could talk him into killing himself, or, like, make him promise not to tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we have to find out what he knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in great pain) I don't know anything...you broke my bong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale, trying to act tough, grabs Red by the collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell us everything. Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red looks to Saul for sympathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at me, you sellout bastard. Now start talking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't...I don't know anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale pulls Saul aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do? He's not gonna talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we beat it out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Red. Here's the deal: if you don't tell us everything, we're going to beat you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't beat me up! Saul, dude, I'm Red!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were Red. Now you're no one to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got five seconds, okay? Ready? Five, four-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale raises his fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three, two...one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red cringes as Dale softly "punches" his gut. It doesn't hurt him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That didn't hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't even hurt him! Hit him hard, man. Like, fucking hit him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale takes a deep breathe and raises his fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! I...I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale grabs a potted plant.
