dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale swings the plant back to strike Red. The pot flies off the plant and Dale smashes the dirt covered roots of the plant against Red's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Fuck, man! Stop it.                             Listen...two...two guys came here,                  they...they were here when you called-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who were they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale raises his fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They work for Ted. Budlofsky and                    Matheson. Fuckin' crazy weird guys. They            were here all day, but you guys didn't show. They said they'd kill me if I didn't bring you to them, they said I'd-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many cops does he have in his...uh, payroll, or whatever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know there's this lady cop. He could have more, I don't know. He's got pretty crazy connections. He's also got a cool-              ass hideout. It's crazy man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale and Saul exchange very worried looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale swings the PLANT upwards, prepared to strike Red again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's his competition?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Asians!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asians? Which Asians? Indians are technically Asian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The...the Koreans, I think. Everyone just calls them the Asians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale and Saul exchange an even more worried look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to god that's all I know...I                  swear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. We should...tie him up and...and get the fuck out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made a gravity bong here once. I know where his duct tape is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul runs off. Dale puts on Saul's backpack and looks at the battered Red moaning on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's tape this piece of shit up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale pulls Red's hands behind his back. Saul is picking at the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't find the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't find the, oh...wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul rips open the DUCT TAPE. He quickly BINDS Red's hands and feet. SUDDENLY, there's a KNOCK at the door. They stop, silent. KNOCK. KNOCK. KNOCK. Red starts thrashing and trying to scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)                                    Shit. They're actually here to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)                                    What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)                                    I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)                                    Fuck. Oh, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frozen in terror, they don't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)                                    Guys, guys...listen to me-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)                                    I'm fuckin' sorry. Okay? I fucked up. I'm              a son-of-a-bitch. I forgot bros before                 hoes, even though these guys aren't hoes.              You know what I mean. But I can fix this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know these guys, it's cool. Just head             out the back, I'll stall `em. Won't tell            `em nothing. You can count on me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red frantically tries to wriggle out of his bonds while Saul leads Dale out the back door. SUDDENLY, the door is KICKED open! Budlofsky and Matheson enter, guns drawn. They see Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale Denton! It was Saul and some dude              named Dale Denton! They just ran out the            back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale and Saul run like hell. Saul spots a dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul jumps into the dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I've got to get to a phone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should hide!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, if Red tells Ted's guys my name, then they'll go to my apartment and find out about Angie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should stay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm in the dumpster already! Shit! Fine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul hops out of the dumpster and follows Dale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Budlofsky dashes back into the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're long gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matheson stands over top of Red, talking to Ted on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find out what he knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red, you gonna tell us anything helpful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just did, Matheson. Fuckin' Dale                    Denton's the other guys name. He was with             Saul, they kicked my ass. What more do                you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask if either of them were Asian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. What skin color were these guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Um...white, they're both white. I think Denton might be a Jew, but I couldn't really tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that, Ted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale Denton. Not Asian. Alright. Kill Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matheson pulls out a gun and shoots Red in the gut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clutching his bleeding gut)                   Oh fuck...you shot me, you motherfucker!              Fuckin' Matheson...fuck you! You've eaten             dinner here, man! Tacos! And now I'm                  gonna fuckin' die from this, probably.                Get the fuck out of my house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TED (the big grey-haired guy) puts his portable phone back in its charger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The living room windows are covered by black sheets. Workers are busy scrubbing blood stains off the floor and walls. The dead Asian man lies on top of bubble-wrap in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted walks into the kitchen where CAROL BRAZIER (female cop from the murder, in full uniform, mid-30s) is playing with her gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol, there's another name to run. Dale Denton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he have something to do with our friend in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the Asians have the balls to send an assassin right into my home, we can't be too cautious. The boys say Denton and Saul are Caucasian. Maybe after their assassin failed, they hired this outside               guy Denton to finish the job.                          (pondering) Also, the boys said that Saul mentioned "going to the casino."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Going to the casino"? I don't like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol holsters her gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside an Escalade with tinted   windows sit two frightening looking Asian men.   They have earphones on a an eavesdropping tool aimed at   Ted's house. They hear every word. One of them writes   down info in Korean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through one of the Asian mens ear piece) I'll be back in an hour with everything there is on Dale Denton. He'll be dead by the time we make our pick-up tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale and Saul are still running and are unbelievably exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping and   wheezing)                       But my parents live   in Canada. You don't think they're going   to go to Canada, do you? How would they   get a Canadian phone book even?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping and wheezing)                         All I know is Angie's new number is on my fridge and they could see that, so I have             to get to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Grandma lives here. They wouldn't go after her, would they? She's got a different last name. Belogus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale hails a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale's apartment door BURSTS open. Budlofsky and Matheson enter, guns drawn. They start searching the apartment. Budlofsky presses a button on the ANSWERING MACHINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Dale's voice)                                 " cough  It's Dale. I'm probably at work,             maybe we'll talk later.  BEEP "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matheson walks to the fridge and yanks off a NOTE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Budlofsky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Budlofsky looks at the note:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: " - Memorize Angie's New Cell: 366-3666 - Go get weed - "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale and Saul get out of the cab in a pleasant neighborhood. Saul begrudgingly pays the driver. They walk towards Angie's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, stay here. I'll be back in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hells no! I don't want to be alone! I want to go with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul, just watch my back. I'll literally               be five minutes. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. But hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale runs up to the front door and frantically knocks. Angie answers the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale dashes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie opens the door with a smile, the phone in hand. Her attention is towards the phone conversation she is having. Dale enters her apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Dale! You came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale freezes in horror: ANGIE'S PARENTS (SHANNON and ROBERT) are pleasantly eating at the dining room table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Dale. Nice to meet you, sit down and               have some couscous. Can I get you a                    drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert sees that Dale is DIRTY, DISHEVELLED, BRUISED and BATTERED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale?   What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert and Shannon exchange worried looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, I was in the woods and...                   (turns to Angie's parents)                    ...Hi, I'm Dale. Uh...it's nice to                   finally meet you both...I apologize for              my appearance. Robert, Charlotte-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not amused)                                  Shannon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Shannon. I've heard a lot about both            of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale walks to Robert and extends his DIRTY, BLOODY HAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert smugly declines Dale's hand shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were in the woods?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at a loss for words)                         Alright, now, here's what's happened -               I've been thrust into a kind of,                     ah...situation. So, uh, if we could all              just start to evacuate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale starts gathering all their jackets and shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...that'd be really, really good right               now. I'll answer all your-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this Angie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it is a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deep breath)                                   Listen. There are people after us and                  they could come here. I'll tell you                    anything you want, just please, let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm serious. Super serious! We have               to get the "F" out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Anderson's stare at him dumbfounded. Robert gets up and stands tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the hell out of my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Mr. Anderson, look, here's the deal              - I saw a crooked cop kill a guy while I               was working...this morning. The cop shot               the guy then saw my car drive off, and I               think they might have seen my license                  plate and, so, I ditched my car...in the               woods, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at Dale as though he were crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul sees a car nearing. He sees Budlofsky and Matheson are in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fucking way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs like hell towards Angie's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie and her parents try to make sense of what Dale is saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are these people? Why are they-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think their drug dealers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the verge of tears) Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's complicated. See, the...uh...it doesn't matter right now, we just have to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go to the police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they are the police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting my gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert! No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We bought it for a reason!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert runs up the stairs to his bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Saul bursts through the front door in a panicked frenzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (completely out of breath) You... huff ...Angie? Dale! It's                      happening!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie grabs a fork off the table and stabs it into Saul's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaking out) Dale, it's one of the drug dealers!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I'm Dale's dealer, I'm S-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie! Stop! It's Saul!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do, Angie?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul yanks the fork out and tosses it on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!! Fuck. Now I'm gonna need a tetanus             shot! They fuckin' kill. Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul? Dale, who is-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale, they're coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then - Robert appears at the top of the stairs with his gun. He sees Saul bleeding and SCREAMS. BLAM! He fires at Saul!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Budlofsky and Matheson are walking towards the front door when they hear the gunshot and dive behind some bushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out your fucking gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG! Blasts through the front door and almost hits them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is in shock. Saul frantically pats himself down to see if he got hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop! He's with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy fuck! Holy fuck! Holy fuck! Holy               fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, put the gun down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just nobody move, okay? Except Shannon               and Angie. So, you two don't move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, please, he's my friend, he's helping            me, he's-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop shooting, man! I'm Dale's dealer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale looks at the pandemonium as everyone tries to be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys! Please! We have to get out of here.            Robert, Angie...Mrs. Anderson-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Dale)                            It's Shannon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know! Look, we have to get out of here.            I'm sure everything is going to be fine              but better safe than...not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this...for real-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Terribly real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale and Saul lead Angie and her parents towards the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Budlofsky and Matheson are now at the front door. They've each got a gun drawn and are preparing to burst in. Budlofsky is loading his bullet cartridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. One sec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Budlofsky puts in the last few bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chill out, man. You're nagging isn't                   helping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Budlofsky cocks his gun and nods at Matheson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! They kick open the doors and run into her house. No one is there. Budlofsky cautiously walks over to the table and touches the food. It's still warm. Matheson bends down and picks up a bloody fork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ew! It's a bloody fork! What are these                 people doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale, Angie, her parents, and Saul burst into the garage. Robert is fumbling with the keys. He manages to open the car. Saul pulls up his shirt to look at the stab wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. Look at that. Fuckin' mashed                     potatoes in my wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby! Get in the car quick. Angie, in the              car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Andersons get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale - get in the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dale)                                       You stay the fuck away from my family!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glances at Robert)                            I...I think it would be best if I didn't              go with you. I don't want to put you in               any more danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do? What should we              do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie, get in the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, baby. Here's the plan - go to                the Holiday Inn downtown and use a fake               name. Something like...                               (looks around, focuses on                      Robert's car)                                 Car...lyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlyle?                                              (beat)                                         I...I have so many questions. I                       just...how can this be happening?                     Where...where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to stop this. I don't know how,                but don't worry. I'll keep you safe.                  (beat)                                         But still, watch your back. You never                 know where they might be, whoever they                are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie gets in the car. Dale pecks her on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie gets in the car. Dale pecks her on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...you're welcome. And nice to meet you            guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shuts her door and the Anderson's pull out. Dale watches them depart with great concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't we in that car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's run, man! Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to sprint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huff   Huff  Where are we running?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere we can think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Carol are in mid-discussion, and rather distraught at that. Behind them two henchmen take the dead Asian man's body out the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fork?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bloody fork. In his girlfriends house.             And the blood was fresh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he killed her, to protect himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe it's the Asians fucking with us. What the fuck is going on! (a frustrated beat) Any luck with the cell phones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smashed one and left the other one              in the woods to distract us. Took us an              hour to find it. And we found Denton's               car, which was filled with all these                 strange disguises. These guys are for                real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted slams his fist on a table. He ponders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to the Asians. Get me Cheung's number. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheung, the leader of the Asians, has a lavish mansion which is covered in ornate decorations and expensive merchandise. It is immaculately clean and organized. Several armed men with earpieces stand in strategic locations throughout the house. Cheung is reading a Korean book alone in his study. The phone rings and he picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Korean) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheung. It's Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheung sits up, shocked to have his opponent calling him. He snaps his fingers and two guards run in. He covers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Korean) Record this conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He uncovers the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perfect English) Ted. This is surprising. What would you like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheung, I want you to call off your man Denton. I don't know what he is, a scout, assassin, and frankly I don't care. I just want him gone. I want him dead. If you do this, I'll consider it a peace offering, otherwise, you're asking for war. And just in case you forgot, I'm number one, and there's a reason for that. You've got 24 hours to reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We stay on Cheung. He hails another guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted Jones is slipping. Our assassin                   failed to kill him, but it did rattle his             confidence. It's earlier than planned,                but we should strike now, while he is                 confused. Let it be known-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to a picture of the Asian Ted killed earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Li-Youngs death will not be in vain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale and Saul are sitting in the branches of a tree. Fast food wrappers lie scattered. Saul is rolling a joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victory joint complete. Here ya go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul passes it to Dale, who lights it. Dale takes another puff and starts to seriously relax. A smile creeps across his face as he passes the joint to Saul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Tell us what you know!" How fuckin' balls was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul takes a puff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like, really balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I think I fought pretty well, don't you? You know, for my first time. We were like Tango and Cash, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or Scarface!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! Knocked the door right off it's hinges!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul passes the joint to Dale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you probably saved Angie, which is fucking pimp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I probably couldn't have done it without you. Thanks, man. It is fucking pimp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in this together, right? So, ya know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul passes the joint to Dale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, man. (beat) You know, my last dealer was a total dick. You're by far the coolest dealer I've ever had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincerely) Wow. Thanks, man. I seriously appreciate that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...like, the time before last time, I           totally had weed. I just kind of wanted             to chill with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over-joyed) Really? That's awesome, man. That means a           lot to me, `cause, like, plenty of dudes            come in to buy and pretend to be all buddy-buddy with me, but in my head I'm always, like, "you don't like me, you like my drugs, so fuck you, buddy!" You know? And just so you know, I totally               could have lit that cross-joint on my own. I'd just have to use candles, but, like, I've never smoked one of those with anyone before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale passes Saul the joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, do you think we should leave town? We           could just get on a bus and go, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We only have, like, fifty bucks. I don't think that could even pay for one ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul rubs the roach out in the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your sack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul rubs his balls again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man. It's still fucking killing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) No dude, your sack of weed. Can't we sell some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. That's my bread and butter. We just have to go to a highschool. It's the easiest market. Chester A. Arthur is                like, a block a way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, man. I'm not going to sell to               kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? They're gonna get it from somewhere.           I mean, we got it from guys like us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then not kids at that school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's a bunch of private ones               nearby, but they're into way crazier shit           than weed-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it, man. I'm not going to a              high school is there anywhere else we               could go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks, then-) We could go to Crackhead Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a park. Really close, actually. Full           of crackheads. They smoke weed too, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are several tarp-houses set up, garbage all over, and crazy/dangerous homeless people milling about the park. A deranged looking homeless man walks over to another one and starts pissing on his leg. They begin fist fighting. Suddenly, a half eaten hamburger hits Dale in the face and a bag lady comes up to Saul and starts poking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, stop it. Stop it. You wanna buy some              weed, or, like, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bag lady runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, that's the problem around here.                   Target demographic has a real, uh, fickle              attention span. You gotta wow `em.                     (beat)                                          Hey! Who wants some weed!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the same high school Angie goes to, Dale and Saul walk up to four thirteen year old students. (DESMOND, WALT, ACK and BLAKE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo. `sup. You guys want some chronic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale and the four kids all laugh hysterically as Saul marches around pretending to be Godzilla, blasting weed smoke out of his nose and mouth as though it was fire. Saul passes Ack the joint. He takes a puff and starts coughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very stoned) Man, this is great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cough   Cough  What's it called again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pineapple express. They said it, like, eight times, you fucking `tard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so sorry if I-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, man. Puff, puff, pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I went here for a year. Kicked            me out for having a swiss army knife. Everyone has a swiss army knife!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got like, thirty for my Bar Mitzvah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DESMOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Bar Mitzvah sucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I touched Jessica Lubell's tit at your Bar Mitzvah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You touched a tit when you were twelve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lubell? Are you joking? Those are the finest tats in the grade!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that, dude. Angie in 12th grade has,           like, the sweetest tits ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You know her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. She's my girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DESMOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. You're that dude. You lucky fucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proud)                                        Yeah. She's pretty sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're all high, that's hilarious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blake passes the joint to Dale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright gentlemen, it's time for me to teach you some business. Brass tacs - this is the best weed you've ever smoked, agreed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids all nod in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'm gonna make this simple. How much did you get between you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred and seventy eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul pulls out his impressive bag of weed. The kids GASP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. You gimme all your money, you can each take two handfuls of weed. That treat ya right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids cheer as Desmond takes two BIG handfuls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fucking awesome!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Keep it on the down low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pay Dale and take their weed. Happy as hell, they run off, stuffing HANDFULS OF WEED into their pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Walt) Jason'll never believe this...until I show him all this weed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale holds the un-lit joint as Saul takes the pot and the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we, my good man, are officially scott fuckin' free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are still people trying to kill us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But at least now we can afford to run. I'm gonna go buy some celebration snacks. Let's have us a little mardi-gras                   fiesta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul laughs as he puts on his backpack and walks around the corner. Dale re-lights the remaining roach and casually smokes. He blows some smoke rings, coughs a bit, stretches; for a few moments, looking completely relaxed, but then-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COP CAR screeches to a halt right in front of Dale! A female POLICE LIAISON OFFICER (who is not Carol) gets out of the car. Dale freezes in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks towards Dale. He seems prepared to run, but she places her hand on a can of pepper spray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move! This stuff hurts. What's in your hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Ma'am. It's weed. I'll get rid of it right away, I was just smoking this. I...I thought it was decriminalized. Or something. For medical purposes. I have epilepsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selling pot to my students isn't "decriminalized." I'm the liaison officer for this school and I just caught four students showing off handfuls of marijuana to their friends. They told me they got it back here. Put your hands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cuffs Dale's hands behind him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! I wasn't selling anything! All I have is this little joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police Liaison takes the large joint out of Dale's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call this little?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws it on the ground and smears it around with her foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even have any money! How did I sell weed if I don't have any money?!? I was just smoking it. I swear. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pats him down, finding only his wallet. The Police Liaison sees he only has nine dollars. She pulls out his DRIVER'S LICENSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's possible you're telling the truth. I'm going to run a check and if it turns out you don't have any priors and all you've got is this small amount of marijuana, I'll let you go with a fine. Take a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks towards her car as Dale sits on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: Saul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul merrily turns into the alley holding TWO RED SLURPEES, when he jumps back in terror! He sees the cop car up the alley. He ducks back behind the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got Dale. Oh fuck, oh fuck, oh fuck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: Dale and the Police Liaison

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at her car computer. The screen reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back at Dale and types into her computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Carol (who is in fact Ted's evil accomplice) speeding down the road. Her police computer beeps. She looks at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Denton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police Liaison stuffs Dale in the back of her squad car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this for? What did that thing tell you? What did I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit and run, Mr. Denton. A double, actually. You hit two parked cars two nights ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of crippling horror comes across Dale's face as she throws him in the back seat and slams his door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: Saul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He peaks down the alley and sees Dale in the back of the car and the FEMALE Police Liaison getting in the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lady cop. She's gonna kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car slowly makes a three point turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand! You have to let me go! Dirty cops are gonna kill me! Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police Liaison ignores Dale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This...this lady cop, and these guys                   Budlofsky and Matheson, they all work for              Ted Jones, and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly interested) Ted Jones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. With grey-hair. Tell me you know what I'm talking about. He lives near Evergreen Heights. He-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you telling me you saw Ted Jones and a police office shoot someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. An Asian someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police Liaison ponders as she finishes her three point turn and drives toward the exit of the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay calm, do as your told, I'll get you down to the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ecstatic) Yes ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul peeks out and sees the approaching cop car. He looks at the two red slurpees and thinks, then suddenly jumps out and THROWS himself onto the hood of the cop car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police Liaison and Dale see a body SLAM against the car and RED LIQUID SPLATTER everywhere, covering the windshield. They SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! In the impact, we clearly see Saul's BALLS getting ROCKED on the car! The Police Liaison slams on the brakes, causing Dale to SMASH into the metal cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god! Is that blood? Oh my god!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts the car in park. As the Police Liaison gets out of her car, Saul can be seen crawling around the back of the vehicle, clutching his testicles. The frightened Police Liaison looks at the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She notices the two slurpee cups on the ground and quickly turns around. She sees Saul jumping into the drivers seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul sees a SHOTGUN beside the passenger seat. The Police Liaison reaches for her GUN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO! What are you doing!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saving you. Hold on, amigo. Tango and Cash!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze mister! Don't even...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul slams the car into reverse! He speeds backwards up the alley as the Police Liaison runs after them - GUN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! She was going to help us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in pain) Oh...my balls...I seriously think I popped one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Carol (the cop from Ted's house) whips her COP CAR into the alley! WHAM!!! It smashes into the rear of their car! Dale turns around and establishes eye contact with the stunned Carol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified) IT'S HER! The lady cop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul slams down the gas! Through the slurpee covered window Saul sees the Police Liaison rushing towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motion at the Police Liaison) Then who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police Liaison raises her gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM! She fires and the bullet punches through the windshield! The Police Liaison dives to the side as they zoom past her! They burst out of the alley. A moment later, Carol follows, in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car weaves through traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The slurpee! I can't see!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn on the wipers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul mindlessly starts grasping at switches in the car. He finally turns on the wipers, which wipe away the slurpee and reveal that the window is so badly cracked he still can't see through it. Carol's car emerges right behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, I seriously can't see!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kick out the window! Isn't that what they do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul, with great effort, keeps one foot on the pedals and, with all his might, kicks his other leg through the front window. His leg PUNCHES straight through the glass, but he can't pull it back in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh fuck! Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it out of there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, their car gets jerked to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! Ah! My leg!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol is ramming them from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hysterical) She's following us! She's gaining on us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her car's better!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul yanks at his leg and manages to wriggle it out of the hole. He begins to accelerate and realizes he can see where he's going through the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! I can see! Through my leg hole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul bumps over the curb and cuts through a LARGE PARK. Carol is right behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul thinks hard, then buckles his seat belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. I've got an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale does what little he can to brace himself. Saul SLAMS on the breaks. Carol sees Saul screeching to a halt and slams on her breaks. She grunts and whips out her GUN. Both cars come to a full stop beside one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens fire - BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! - Bullets rip through the stolen cruiser. Shattered glass flies everywhere. Dale and Saul desperately duck for cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul hits the gas and the bullet riddled car takes off. Carol follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul pops back up and begins steering again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit, man! I'm sorry! I thought she'd keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car bumps back on to a main road. Carol follows, sirens blaring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn on the sirens!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul's hand flails around, grasping everything. He feels the SHOTGUN and accidentally pulls the trigger-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! The blast blows through the roof of the car and hits an overhead TRAFFIC LIGHT - shredding it to pieces!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAUL                          DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol flies into the intersection on a collision course with Saul and Dale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRUNCH! A car smashes into the side of the Carol's cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Dale and Saul speed off, Carol emerges from the smoking wreckage, a look of hate in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stolen cruiser screeches to a halt and Saul hops out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts running up the block at top speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale, still handcuffed in the back of the cruiser, starts thrashing and screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul! Saul! I'm locked in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale continues to scream as Saul obliviously bolts to the end of the block and just keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dumb fucking fuck!!! HELP ME!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale sits in the car, helpless. He has a look of utter disbelief on his face. After a moment of silence he starts wildly kicking the door window. He soon gives up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Dale notices Saul, over a block away, running back towards the stolen car. Saul soon arrives, completely out of breath, and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... huff ... huff ...fuckin' sorry... huff ...forgot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale flops out of the car and onto the grass. Saul tries to help him to his feet, but Dale pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch me, you asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale wiggles to his feet runs for it. Saul follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale and Saul enter the hardware store, walking very close together so that no one sees Dale is handcuffed. They receive a few odd looks as they search and locate what they are looking for: saws. Saul quickly finds a sturdy looking hack-saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, only one way to do this, hard and                fast. Bend over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale gets on his knees and bends over, pressing his face up against the wall. Saul begins to manically hack away at the cuffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Ow! Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Saul sees a store clerk coming and shoves the saw underneath Dale's suit jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which saw do you like most?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brown ones nice, but the metallic                  ones seems more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch the clerk walk off and immediately return to sawing the handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale stretches his arms. The handcuffs are still on his hands, but no longer attached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved) Okay, I'm going to go call Angie. Be                   right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thank you would be nice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I have the, uh, Carlyle room, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie is watching TV alone in a hotel room. The phone rings and she picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie! Thank god you're okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. How are you? Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm great. I'm fine. I miss you. So,                 here's the plan, babe. I'm going to leave            town and contact a government official or something. From somewhere safe. I know               this shit is all fucked up and I just                can't apologize enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale. I've realized some problems and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know there's a problem! That's the thing, that's why I-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale, shut up and listen. People are                 trying to kill you, and me! Dale, drug               dealers are trying to kill me, because of            you! It's fucking over, man. Are you                 kidding me? For gods sake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie, no! No! Don't you get it? I was               thrown into this situation, I had no                 control, but I am dealing with it. This              kind of thing happens, you know-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)                                        You're immature, Dale! I'm six years                 younger and I'm saying this! And the fact            that you think you're some kind of fucking genius just makes it a hundred times more infuriating!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You're telling me you think I'm a dumb guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not how you think you are Dale, and it's pathetic. Call me when I can go            home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Dale walks out of his phone booth, we see that Saul is on the phone in the next booth and is also smoking from a pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alrghit, I'll see you soon. And I'm sorry           again about the clocks.                             (beat)                                       Ha! What a douche bag.                              (beat)                                       Yeah, love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul hangs up and exits the phone booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, so before we go on the lamb I gotta             go see my grandma, okay? She was worried            `cause I didn't show up to help with the            locks. But before that I've got to smoke            another bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you joking? You're actually gonna smoke marijuana?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you smoke marijuana after what we just went through? That clearly happened because we were smoking marijuana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It happened because those fucking kids didn't keep that shit on the down low. Which is weird, `cause they really             seemed like cool kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you haven't noticed, we're not very functional when we're stoned, Saul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I saved you with those Slurpees I was stoned. What do you gotta say to that? Maybe the pot is what gave me the creative capacity to come up with such a great plan! The Beatles were high!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't save me! She was going to protect us, and now we're wanted for all sorts of crazy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul lights his bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Smoke marijuana. But you know how "Scarface" ends. Face down, dead, in your own fuckin' water fountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For one thing, I'm done dealing pot. Mostly, because I don't know where I would get it now, but still. And "b", fuck you, man. You can't judge me. We're exactly the same, and this whole thing's your fucking fault. You're the one who dropped the roach!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not my fault!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale points at Saul's bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's marijuana's fault!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop calling it marijuana!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grow up, you fucking two year old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See! This is why you're a douche bag,                  Denton. Because you think you're better                than others, but you're just a dumb                    pothead burnout, same as me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I am a pothead burnout, but at                   least I'm not the dumbest most annoying                guy in the world. The only reason I ever               bought weed from you was because you're                shit is so good, not because you're cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you said you bought when you already               had a few times, just to hang out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit! I just like...liked having lots              of different kinds of weed at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul takes out his wad of cash and throws half of it at Dale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Buy yourself a good last meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws fifty more cents at the shocked Dale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Super size it, bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul! I'm sorry, man! I didn't mean all                that! Saul!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sad Dale starts picking up the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol, who is a little bruised up from the car crash, sits with Ted. They are both furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy drove like a mother-fucker. It was                 amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not good. We should have this under control. We haven't heard shit from              the Asians. Got these lunatics after us.               Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol checks her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should probably get to the farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC UP: THE END by THE DOORS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Saul gets on a bus and sits down, sad and deject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Dale sits against the phone booth, crying like a baby. He buries his hands in his pocket and pulls out his baggy of weed. He hurls it away. He gets up to retrieve it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Saul is in a really shitty fast food restaurant, nearly crying as he eats his burger and fries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Dale stares at a joint in his hands, thinks for a moment, and then, crying profusely, lights it and starts smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A solitary tear rolls down his cheek and drips directly onto the tip of the joint, putting it out. Dale hears the sizzle and looks at the joint. He continues crying. He puts the joint down, beside three large roaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Walking down the street, Saul sees the Point Grey Retirement Home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Dale feverishly looks through the phone book. He finds what he's looking for: Belogus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Saul, hiding behind a bush across the street, surveys the retirement home. Seeing the coast is clear, he walks towards the entrance. As Saul enters the building, Budlofksy and Matheson pull up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul casually walks into the lobby. The elderly residents of the retirement home are milling around the massive common room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul turns and sees an ELDERLY WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Mrs. Mendelson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul peers over her shoulder and sees Budlofsky and Matheson walk in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul runs for it, and they chase after him. He maneuvers through the elderly like a pylon course, the thugs right on his ass. He bursts into another room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tears through the room, filled with old people eating. Budlofsky and Matheson pursue him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Saul runs through the hall, Budlofksy and Matheson appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matheson whip out his gun and fires - BLAM! The bullet whizzes past Saul and two elderly men, who don't even flinch, and then shatters a distant window. Saul turns the corner and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! He slams into someone, sending the person crashing to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OW! Shit...ow, ow, ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul looks, terrified he's hurt an old person, but sees it is a young male nurse. He runs for it and sees an open door with chatter coming from inside. He runs into-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dead end! Several startled OLD WOMEN look up from their Majong. One of them instantly recognizes Saul-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solly Silver?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Corber! You gotta hide me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Budlofsky and Matheson bursts into the room. Saul looks around, sees a teapot and grabs it. He hurls it at Matheson and nails him in the face. The tea pot shatters and hot water pours all over his face and hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Budlofsky GRABS Saul and knees him in the balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wheezing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Budlofsky punches Saul in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale hustles towards the entrance of the building when he sees several police cars parked outside, their lights flashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees a bunch of old people gathered on the front lawn. Doing his best to avoid the cops, he joins the cluster of elderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, god this is terrible. Poor Faye.                   Poor, poor Faye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, uh, what's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faye Belogus' grandson was kidnapped from              right inside the building. We all saw it.              They fought in the majong room and hurt                the new nurse, Stefan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I was there, I would've kicked an ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale looks, circle of people comforting a crying old woman, clearly Faye Belogus. He walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Belogus. I wouldn't worry, Saul's              going to be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale walks off, determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul wakes up but can't see anything. From his POV we see tape get ripped off his eyes and mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul sees a BUDLOFSKY wielding a knife. He struggles and realizes that his arms and legs are bound. Saul closes his eyes, assuming he's about to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to himself) Fuck. I regret everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUDLOFSKY cuts the tape away from Saul's legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul gets up and hops out of the car. He looks around and see that he is in a LARGE BARN. Saul notices SIX THUGS talking as they move bricks of weed and cocaine into a van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matheson appears and looks at Saul with smoldering hatred. Saul sees that his face and neck were burnt from the tea and the broken shards of pot cut his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh fuck. That looks painful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matheson walks over, lowers to one knee, and punches him straight in the balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matheson whips out his gun and shoves it in Saul's mouth. Budlofsky taps Matheson on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't. Ted wants him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matheson looks at the wheezing Saul, curled over by his feet, and punches him in the back of the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matheson pokes Saul in the back with his gun, ushering him towards the corner of the barn. They come to an old TRAP DOOR. Matheson opens the hatch and they descend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul is led along a narrow tunnel. As they reach the end, Saul's eyes go wide. He enters the same massive metal room that the government used in the 30s (at the beginning of the movie)...only now it is rather worn down, and filled with HUNDREDS OF HUGE MARIJUANA PLANTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breath-taken) El Dorado.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matheson urges Saul through the dense forest of weed, passing several of Ted's thugs, the hum of the giant grow lights filling the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, look at all this weed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up and keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Matheson ushers Saul through the foliage, Saul notices a strange suit that resembles an old fashioned scuba diving uniform (the one from the 1930s intro) hanging on a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at a door. Matheson opens it and shoves Saul in, causing him to almost trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the same room Private Miller was in. Matheson shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! Dale kicks open Red's door and dashes into Red's, ready for anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Anyone here? Red?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale starts looking around. He hears music and then sees he's stepping in a pool of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale follows the music into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale enters and is shocked to see Red lying on the floor, clenching his bloody gut with one hand and a joint and beer in the other. The music is coming from a small boom box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little out of it)                            What? Who the fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red turns toward Dale and picks up a kitchen knife with his bloody hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay the fuck back, Denton! I didn't do                shit! I'll gut ya if I have to, tooled ya              once, tool ya again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (utterly shocked)                               I...what? I'm not here to fight, man, I-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, man. I'm fuckin' tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red drops the knife and then takes a puff of his joint and a sip of his beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dyin', Denton. Fuckin' shot. Right                 here-                                                  (he points at his wound)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having a little going away party and               I don't remember inviting you,                         cocksucker. So I'm gonna ask you to                    leave. In my dying moments, I don't want               some asshole I barely know around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to the hospital, man! Are you crazy.                You don't have to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do! What? I go to the hospital, I'm              gonna end up in But that doesn't matter                `cause once Ted finds out, which he will,              I'm dead wherever I am. I'm fucked                     through and through. Now if you'd be                   willing to give a dying man his wish,                  could ya run on into the other room and                pop in disc two of Tu Pacs "All Eyez On                Me". I want to listen to it while I die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you stop saying that, I've excepted               it, man. I'm at peace.  cough

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red takes a hit and coughs. It clearly brings terrible pain to his bullet wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red, I need you to tell me where Ted's                 base is. He took Saul, and I can't bail                on him. I'm going to get him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red stares intensely at Dale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin eh, amigo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red heroic-ish-ly rises from the floor. He hobbles over to the hall and opens a cabinet on the wall. Dale looks in and sees several hand guns inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaze of glory, motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale and Red are in Red's car, a FORD FIESTA, driving through the countryside. Dale stops the car 100 yards from the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is awesome! We're so gonna show                 those motherfuckers. Think they can kill             me? Fuck no, you can't! Not how I roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red gets out and walks to the drivers side. Dale gets out, gun in hand. Red gets in the drivers seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, this is the backside of the farm. If             you stay low in the grass you should be              fine. If someone is shooting at you with             an automatic weapon, zig zag. It makes               you harder to hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not coming to help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck no! I've been shot. By these guys. I            was in shock before, but the air on the              drive cleared my mind, I should get to               the hospital. You saw Reservoir Dogs,                right? I got shot in the best spot                   possible. I could have a long and                    fruitful life ahead of me. Full of                   possibilities. Go get `em, slugger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how do I get out of here if I rescue             Saul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've no idea. I'm sure it won't be that              hard. Kill some dude and take his car, or            just take it or whatever. Good luck,                 amigo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red drives off. Dale takes a deep breath, clenches his gun, and starts cautiously moving towards the barn. He checks to make sure his safety is off and he's ready to fight. Dale sneaks up on the building and pears in between two boards. He sees Budlofsky supervising as the thugs load the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Budlofsky is about to light a cigarette, when SUDDENLY Dale does a jumping role into the burn and then quickly scampers to his feet and puts a gun to THUG 1's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll blow his fuckin' brains out if you                don't-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM! Budlofsky shoots Thug 1 in the chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale drops his gun and puts his hands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck was that, Budlofsky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you seen "Speed"? "Shoot the                   hostage".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the leg, you fucking moron!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Budlofsky points his gun at Thug 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still worked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two of the thugs grab Dale and punch him several times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw him in with the other guy, and                   everyone stay alert. Jared, go watch                   outside. This is fucked up. Somethings                 going down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thugs start bringing Dale towards the hatch. Suddenly one of them motions for the other to stop, feeling something on Dale's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's got a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thug 3 lifts up Dale's shirt, revealing that he has taped a gun to his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding me, right? Die Hard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thugs bring him down the trap door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! He's got another one taped to his              stomach!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And his leg!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul is sitting against the wall with his hands bound and a look of complete defeat. Suddenly, the door opens and Dale is tossed in by Budlofsky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale!?! What the fuck? Did you rat me out, you shitty bastard? That what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I came here to save you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To save me? Ha! That's rich! You're                 caught, too. And now I have to die with             some asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul, I deserved that, because I fucked             you. You're right, this whole things my             fault, and they only way I can make it up           to you is by rescuing you, and that's why           I'm here. To save my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell ya what, Dale. You actually save me            and I'll consider forgiving you for this            mad shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. `Cause I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh really? What, you forget to tell me you shoot lasers out of your eyes, or you got some kind of secret blowtorch strapped to your dick? We're not gonna escape, Dale, we're losers, and sinners, and after we die, we're gonna go to hell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not losers! We did that car chase. That was all you, man! You got away from the cops. I've watched, like, nine billion hours of worlds wildest police chases and I've never seen a guy get away. Not once! But you did it. You did the impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, they both hear someone coming. The door opens. Matheson pokes his head, and gun, in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can hear you out there, and it's annoying. Shut the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks Dale and Saul up and down, then shuts the door. Dale sits down and thinks, but is disturbed by his belt buckle, which is digging into his gut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Perfect! Now rub your wrists against my belt! My belt buckle'll cut the tape. Do it! This is it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul is hesitant, but awkwardly gets in position anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an unavoidably sexual-looking motion, Saul begins to gyrate against Dale's belt buckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed) Yes! Yes! You know what this is called,                Saul? This is called saving you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barn door slides open. Ted and Carol walk in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got them downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you find them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found Saul at his grandmother's and                 Dale Denton busted in here like a madman,              armed to the teeth, and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Budlofsky looks over at the man he shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he just plugged Frank and then I                 disarmed him. We got `em both holed up                 downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shot Frank? Jesus. Fuckin' Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is this Dale Denton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five Asian men lay on their stomachs in the tree line dressed in black and armed with machine guns. One of them stares through a pair of night-vision binoculars while utilizing a listening device. We see his view of Ted and hear what he hears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we'll torture these two bastards                 and find out everything they know. What                about the shipment? Ready to move out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be good to in 10 minutes or so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Asian leader nods and does some hand signals to his men. The acknowledge they understand. He holds up a flashlight and flashes three times. From the opposing side of the barn two other flashlights blink back. They all get up and start to slowly move towards the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale and Saul are still "humping" away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't working. Turn around. I'm using my mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale drops to his knees and starts gnawing at the tape on Saul's hands. Suddenly, they hear approaching footsteps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Someone's coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Yo - if I cough, I'm going to make a move, if I cough twice, you take the                   lead. Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) What? No! What if you actually cough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale stands up just as Matheson walks in, gun drawn. Dale looks at Saul and notices that he's managed to free his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale COUGHS TWICE. Saul shoots him a worried look and shakes his head. Matheson notices. Saul COUGHS TWICE. Dale shoots him a confused look. Saul motions at him and COUGHS TWICE MORE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man, whatever you're doing, I get it, okay? So just stop it, alright? Just cut it-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM! Matheson shoots at Dale's head! Dale falls to the ground, specks of blood hitting Saul as he dives forwards, TACKLING Matheson into the wall!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Matheson's gun slides across the room, hitting Dale's motionless body. Saul scrambles for the gun and grabs it. Matheson gets to his feet. Saul turns and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM! He shoots Matheson in the gut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit, man! I'm sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matheson writhes in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul turns to see Dale lying face down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Carol talk as Budlofsky and the thugs silently stands by. Ted is holding a large hunting knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has anyone seen my bigger knife?                       (beat)                                          Do you guys hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY, there is an EXPLOSION and a hole is blown in the barn wall. Budlofsky is blasted back and badly torn up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arg...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asian assassins start pouring into the barn. One of them sees the wounded Budlofsky and blasts him away with a machine gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitled in Korean)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
